etymology.description: semantic 水(水) (shuǐ, "water") + phonetic 齐(齊) (qí, "together/even") = crossing or helping across water -> aid, ferry over
etymology.interpretation: The character 济(濟) conveys the idea of aiding or crossing by associating water, essential for crossing rivers, with 齐(齊) (qí, "together/even"), to imply guiding or helping across. This reflects both the literal act of ferrying across water and the metaphorical sense of providing assistance.
etymology.simplification: 济 is simplified from 濟 by replacing 齊(齊) (qí, "together/even") with its simplified form 齐(齐). This reflects the standardization process where complex traditional components are simplified for ease of writing while retaining phonetic elements.

examples.chinese: 他济困扶危(他濟困扶危)。
政府济急解困(政府濟急解困)，民众献爱心(民眾獻愛心)。
examples.pinyin: Zhèngfǔ jì jí jiě kùn, mínzhòng xiàn àixīn.
examples.english: The government quickly relieves the crisis, while the people donate their love.

examples.chinese: 船家济渡旅客(船家濟渡旅客)，使他们安全过河(使他們安全過河)。
examples.pinyin: Chuánjiā jì dù lǚkè, shǐ tāmen ānquán guò hé.
examples.english: The boatman ferries passengers, ensuring they safely cross the river.
